description: Borrowed from Latin impendere (“to hang over, to weigh out”).

verbs.description: impend (third-person singular simple present impends, present participle impending, simple past and past participle impended)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To hang or be suspended over (something); to overhang.
examples: The Earl had often heard of a rich citizen  […]  and the peculiar charm of a little snug rotunda which he had just finished on the verge of his ground, and which impended the great London road.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) Figuratively to hang over (someone) as a threat or danger.
(intransitive) To threaten to happen; to be about to happen, to be imminent.
